messages.message:
@Xindi Xu, it has happened twice today where a feature that I am actively working on and is far from complete is having it’s feature flag turned on by solution engineers, who are then confused when the feature is not working. Right now my feature in question is under `Internal Opt in` which has the following description: `Opt-in features might not be fully stable but are available for testing...`  — however in this case I think we should actually specify that this feature is *not* available for testing.

I wonder if we’ve thought about this case with our current feature flagging system?
yea, i think we should make IB-Opt-In as `features that are work-in-progress and are not available for testing`
I think sometimes we do want users to opt in to features and test them out, I was thinking that we might want another tier for these in development features
The description is for the new feature flag system is the same as the old one, btw. I think it makes sense to change both since IB-Opt-In is the initial stage of the feature flag
maybe an easier way to do this is to add the "(wip)" to the feature flag title/description since the logic is the same code-wise

i like this “(wip)” idea!

i also think it’s rare that IB-Opt-In feature are available for testing, so i think we can change the message to `Opt-in features are not fully stable and should only be used for eng-internal testing`

i don’t think it’s worth creating a new feature flag tier since basically all IB-Opt-In features are in this category and shouldn’t be used by solution eng
@Serena should I let the team know that no IB-Opt In features should be used?
Also please let me know which features we are okay to use while doing dev?

I do agree that in general opt in features shouldn’t be used for testing but I guess I was thinking about cases like auto save where we did want to have users test while in opt in state. Either way, if we don’t want to add a new tier I agree adding “WIP” is a good solution!

we didn’t want users to test autosave in IB-Opt-In state because we got a lot of bug reports for issues that we already solved :lolcry:

that’s why we kept on turning it back off by default
@Piyush yes IB-Opt-In features shouldn’t be used, and all other features should be safe to use
I’m going to make an announcement in <#C05BJCNKZAM|> as well
Yea, maybe we can do the other way around, since IB-Opt-in by default shouldn't be used. For cases like auto-save, we can add "ready for testing" to the feature flag title and keep it at IB-opt-in
That makes sense, and then, as discussed, we should update the description for opt in to say that these features generally shouldn’t be used for testing unless explicitly stated

@Arjun can you please give me a blurb ion direction for the team. It seems like we want to have a flag for IB-Opt In which will be only for Eng testing but there maybe a modified title for Opt in where we can test it out internally? Want to make sure i can give clear info to the team

@Piyush sure — In general, any feature under the “Internal Opt in” section of feature flags should not be used as it is still under active development and will either be incomplete or unstable. The only exception to this is if the feature flag itself explicitly has the “[Ready to Review]” tag
ok thank you . i will share with the Sol Eng team as well
